questions.question: What is Angular primarily used for?
questions.explanation: Angular is a framework for building dynamic web applications, allowing developers to create interactive user interfaces.

questions.question: Which of the following is a core concept of Angular
questions.explanation: Angular is built around core concepts like components, templates, and directives, which work together to create applications.

questions.question: How do you create a new Angular component
questions.explanation: The correct command to create a new Angular component using Angular CLI is ng generate component.

questions.question: Which module is required for using ngModel
questions.explanation: The FormsModule is necessary to use ngModel for two-way data binding in Angular forms.

questions.question: How do you add a global HTTP header in Angular
questions.explanation: An HttpInterceptor is used to add global HTTP headers to all outgoing requests in Angular.

questions.question: Which command initializes a new Angular application
questions.explanation: The command ng new is used to initialize a new Angular application.

questions.question: What is a structural directive
options: It modifies the behavior of a component
It changes the appearance of an element
It alters the structure of the DOM
questions.explanation: Structural directives modify the structure of the DOM by adding or removing elements.

questions.question: Which lifecycle hook runs after the component's view has been fully initialized
questions.explanation: The ngAfterViewInit lifecycle hook is called after the component's view has been fully initialized.

questions.question: What does the async pipe do
options: Waits for a promise to resolve
Automatically subscribes to an observable and unsubscribes on destroy
Converts a promise to an observable
questions.explanation: The async pipe automatically subscribes to an observable or promise and unsubscribes when the component is destroyed.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the @Input decorator
options: To receive data from a parent component
questions.explanation: The @Input decorator is used to receive data from a parent component in Angular.
